quest.name: As the Gods Will
journal: Gosetsu has seen enough of Dotharl Khaa.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: You are ready to depart, I trust? Good. Then let us away.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: We can but tell Magnai the truth. And if our most radiant brother is unsatisfied, it will be my pleasure to put an end to this charade.

dialogue.name: DAIDUKUL
dialogue.text: You are alive...and returned. No matter. All hinges on what you have to say.

dialogue.name: BAATU
dialogue.text: Welcome, travelers. The most radiant brother will hear your tale.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: All that you have seen and heard. Your knowledge. I would have it.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: ...No secret stratagems, you say. That is well. I expected as much.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: The Dotharl are not schemers. They live only for war─for the contest of strength and will. They are fierce, aye, and to face one is to court death.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: "Meet us on the field, and make ready to ride with your ancestors.“ Such were the words of their khatun, Sadu.

dialogue.name: BAATU
dialogue.text: Speak not that devil's name in the presence of the most radiant!

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: You bade us tell you of the Dotharl, yet you will not hear the name of their leader?

dialogue.name: BAATU
dialogue.text: After the last Naadam, she gave great offense.

dialogue.name: BAATU
dialogue.text: The most radiant brother called to him the women of the Steppe, that he might look into their eyes and see if Nhaama looked back.

dialogue.name: BAATU
dialogue.text: But that gedan, that feral udgan! She spat curses and called forth flames! She scorched the soil and refused to present herself!

dialogue.name: BAATU
dialogue.text: Three days and nights had we fought to claim the Dawn Throne, and still she shows Brother Magnai such disrespect! Such defiance! By rights should she pay with her life!

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: Speak not another word, Baatu, or you will pay with yours.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: Her words are air, as the Domans say. However, they are proof of your service to the Sun.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: Go and fetch the others from their cells.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: My lord, Lyse, you are unharmed?

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Thanks to you and Forename. We are free to return to Mol Iloh, I take it?

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: By your deeds have you proven yourselves to be warriors brave and true.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: You may return to the Mol and make ready for the Naadam...on one condition.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: To fight in the Naadam is to be bound by it. Swear, here and now, to abide by the law of the Steppe. To accept the supreme authority of the khagan, whomsoever it may be.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: (-All-)We swear!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: In a way, being forced to stay behind may actually have been a good thing. I had a lot of time to think, and usually I don't...

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Let us not be too quick to count our blessings. We must still win the Naadam.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: When next we meet, it will be on the field of battle. You will kneel, or you will die.

dialogue.name: DAIDUKUL
dialogue.text: The Buduga will stand with the Oronir, and victory will be ours, as before.

dialogue.name: BAATU
dialogue.text: I like you, traveler. That is why I will kill you last.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Well done, my friends. I knew you would not fail.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: I should be glad to hear of your experiences with the Dotharl, but as time is of the essence, let us converse en route.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Come, come─Cirina and the others are waiting!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: It's almost time for the Naadam! I'm so excited!

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Though our journey home was rather more roundabout than I had anticipated, it was also more educational. I think it safe to say we are better prepared for the experience.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: There is a tension in the air─an awareness of the coming storm. A nervousness, aye, but a confidence as well. Faith, perchance...

dialogue.name: TEMULUN
dialogue.text: Today's enemies are tomorrow's allies. Remember this.

dialogue.name: MOLA02514
dialogue.text: How my heart throbs with excitement! I can wait no longer for the Naadam!

dialogue.name: MOLC02514
dialogue.text: A-All shall be well. I must have faith in myself and my yol...

dialogue.name: MOLD02514
dialogue.text: Though we must ware the Oronir, it is the Dotharl who frighten me most of all. I have seen them in battle before. They are not men─they are monsters.

dialogue.name: MOLE02514
dialogue.text: It has been many years since the gods bade the Mol fight in the Naadam. For us, it is the first time. The khatun says we will win, but...will we?

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: Thank the gods you are all right! When you failed to return, I feared the worst.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: But here you are, hale and whole! And you survived Bardam's Mettle!

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: Blessed are we to have you as allies. With your strength, we may have a chance...
